src.engines.auxiliary module

class src.engines.auxiliary.SubPopulation(pop_id: int, population: list = <factory>)[source]

Bases: object

Auxiliary class container used in the IslandModelGA to hold all the subpopulations (one on each island).

property id: int

Accessor (getter) of the id parameter.

Returns:

the id value.

pop_id: int
population: list
src.engines.auxiliary.apply_corrections(input_population: list[Chromosome]) → int[source]

Check the population for invalid genes and correct them by applying directly the random method. It is assumed that the random method of the Gene is always returning a ‘valid’ value for the Gene.

Parameters:

input_population – List(Chromosome) the population we want to

apply corrections (if applicable).

Returns:

the total number of corrected genes in the population.

src.engines.island_model_ga module

class src.engines.island_model_ga.IslandModelGA(initial_pop: list[Chromosome], fit_func: Callable, num_islands: int, select_op: SelectionOperator | None = None, mutate_op: MutationOperator | None = None, cross_op: CrossoverOperator | None = None, migrate_op: ClockwiseMigration | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

In Island Model GA we run in parallel a number of “islands”, each one evolving its own (sub)-population. Optionally we can allow “migration”, among the best individuals from each island.

MAX_CPUs = 4
best_chromosome()[source]

Auxiliary method.

Returns:

Return the chromosome with the highest fitness.

evaluate_fitness(in_population: list[Chromosome])[source]

Evaluate all the chromosomes of the input population list with the custom fitness function. After updating all the chromosomes with their fitness, the method returns the average statistics mean/std.

Parameters:

in_population – (list) The population of Chromosomes that we

want to evaluate their fitness.

Returns:

mean(fitness), std(fitness).

static evolve_population(island: SubPopulation, eval_fitness: Callable, epochs: int, crs_op: CrossoverOperator, mut_op: MutationOperator, sel_op: SelectionOperator, rnd_gen, f_tol: float = 1e-06, correction: bool = False, elitism: bool = True)[source]

This method is called to evolve each subpopulation independently. It is declared ‘static’ to avoid problems when passed in the Parallel pool. The input parameters have identical meaning with the ones from the run().

fitness_func
num_islands
population
rng_GA = Generator(PCG64) at 0x7FD1984B7300
run(epochs: int = 1000, correction: bool = False, elitism: bool = True, f_tol: float = 1e-06, allow_migration: bool = False, n_periods: int = 10, verbose: bool = False)[source]

Main method of the StandardGA class, that implements the evolutionary routine.

Parameters:

  • epochs – (int) maximum number of iterations in the evolution process.

  • correction – (bool) flag that if set to ‘True’ will check the validity of

the population (at the gene level) and attempt to correct the genome by calling the random() method of the flawed gene.

Parameters:

elitism – (bool) flag that defines elitism. If ‘True’ then the chromosome

with the higher fitness will always be copied to the next generation (unaltered).

Parameters:

f_tol – (float) tolerance in the difference between the average values of two

consecutive populations. It is used to determine the convergence of the population.

Parameters:

allow_migration – (bool) flag that if set to ‘True’ will allow the migration

of the best individuals among the different islands.

Parameters:

n_periods – (int) the number of times that we will break the main evolution

to allow for chromosomes to migrate. NB: This setting is active only when the option allow_migration == True. Otherwise, is ignored.

Parameters:

verbose – (bool) if ‘True’ it will display periodically information about the

current stats of the subpopulations. NB: This setting is active only when the option allow_migration == True. Otherwise, is ignored.

Returns:

None.

property stats

Accessor method that returns the ‘stats’ dictionary.

Returns:

the dictionary with the statistics from the run.

src.engines.standard_ga module

class src.engines.standard_ga.StandardGA(initial_pop: list[Chromosome], fit_func: Callable, select_op: SelectionOperator | None = None, mutate_op: MutationOperator | None = None, cross_op: CrossoverOperator | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Standard GA model that at each iteration replaces the whole population using the genetic operators (crossover and mutation).

their fitness.

Parameters:

Returns:

the mean and std of the fitness values.

rng_GA = Generator(PCG64) at 0x7FD196AFD620
run(epochs: int = 100, elitism: bool = True, correction: bool = False, f_tol: float = 1e-08, parallel: bool = False, verbose: bool = False)[source]

Main method of the StandardGA class, that implements the evolutionary routine.

Parameters:

  • epochs – (int) maximum number of iterations in the evolution process.

  • elitism – (bool) flag that defines elitism. If ‘True’ then the chromosome

with the higher fitness will always be copied to the next generation (unaltered).

Parameters:

correction – (bool) flag that if set to ‘True’ will check the validity of

the population (at the gene level) and attempt to correct the genome by calling the random() method of the flawed gene.

Parameters:

f_tol – (float) tolerance in the difference between the average values of

two consecutive populations. It is used to determine the convergence of the population.

Parameters:

  • parallel – (bool) Flag that enables parallel computation of the fitness function.

  • verbose – (bool) if ‘True’ it will display periodically information about

the current average fitness and spread of the population.

Returns:

None.

property stats

Accessor method that returns the ‘stats’ dictionary.

Returns:

the dictionary with the statistics from the run.

update_stats(avg_fitness: float, std_fitness: float)[source]

Update the stats dictionary with the input mean/std values of the fitness.

Parameters:

  • avg_fitness – (float) mean fitness value of the population.

  • std_fitness – (float) std fitness value of the population.

Returns:

None.
